name: James Hoffmann Chemex recipe
description: Chemex recipe by James Hoffmann, winner of World Barista Championship, YouTuber, coffee consultant, and author. James recommends almost the same technique as for V60.

steps.instruction: Grind the beans, boil the water, prepare Chemex with rinsed filter, add grounds, zero the scale.
Add {2 * coffeeAmount}-{3 * coffeeAmount}g of water.
Stir to wet all the grounds, let it bloom.
Add water in a circular motion until you reach {0.6 * waterAmount}g.
Continue to add water until you reach {waterAmount}g.
Stir clockwise and counter-clockwise with a spoon.
Give the Chemex a little shake.
Wait until drawdown completes.
Grind coffee, heat water, prepare Chemex with rinsed filter, add grounds.
Pre-wet with {2 * coffeeAmount}g of water, pour in spiral pattern.
Let the coffee bloom.
Pour in concentric circles until the water reaches the top of the Chemex.
Wait for grounds to return to original level.
Repeat full immersion pours until you reach {waterAmount}g. Wait for drawdown.
Grind coffee, heat water, prepare Chemex with rinsed filter, add grounds.
Pre-wet with {2 * coffeeAmount}g of water to saturate the grounds.
Let the coffee bloom.
Add up to {0.33 * waterAmount}g of water in circular motion.
Wait.
Add water until scale reads {0.64 * waterAmount}g.
Wait for 2 minutes.
Add water to {waterAmount}g. Wait for drawdown.

name: Scott Rao Chemex recipe
description: Chemex recipe by Scott Rao, a coffee expert and author specializing in barista training, coffee roasting, and brewing.

steps.instruction: Grind coffee, heat water, prepare Chemex with rinsed filter, add grounds.
Pre-wet with {1.5 * coffeeAmount}g of water.
Gently dig in the coffee bed with a small spoon.
Wait for bloom.
Pour until {waterAmount}g in circular patterns.
Light stir at slurry edge.
Move Chemex in circles.
Wait for drawdown.
